citation.article-title: Paenibacillus cellulositrophicus sp. nov., a cellulolytic bacterium from Thai soil
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Paenibacillus cellulositrophicus sp. nov.

Paenibacillus cellulositrophicus [cel.lu.lo.si.tro′phi.cus. N.L. n. cellulosum cellulose; N.L. adj. trophicus (from Gr. adj. trophikos) nursing, tending; N.L. masc. adj. cellulositrophicus feeding on cellulose, growing on cellulose].
Motile by means of peritrichous flagella.
Central or subterminal ellipsoidal endospores are observed in swollen sporangia.
Colonies are white or white–cream, circular, convex and with an entire margin (0.9–2.3 mm diameter).
Growth occurs at pH 5–9 (optimally at pH 6–7), at 20–55 °C (optimally at 30–37 °C) and in 5 % (w/v) NaCl, but not at 10–15 °C or in 6 % NaCl.

Positive for catalase and oxidase activities, for hydrolysis of aesculin, l-arginine, gelatin and casein, for activities of DNase and urease and for citrate utilization, but negative for hydrolysis of starch, l-tyrosine and Tween 80, for nitrate reduction, for the MR–VP reaction and for production of indole and hydrogen sulphide and for the production of dihydroxyacetone from glycerol.

Acid production from adonitol, aesculin, amygdalin, d-arabinose, l-arabinose, arbutin, cellobiose, d-fructose, d-galactose, gentiobiose, d-glucose, N-acetylglucosamine, methyl α-d-glucoside, d-lactose, maltose, d-mannitol, d-mannose, methyl α-d-mannoside, melezitose, melibiose, raffinose, l-rhamnose, d-ribose, salicin, starch, trehalose, turanose, d-xylose, sucrose and methyl β-d-xyloside.

No acid is produced from d-arabitol, l-arabitol, dulcitol, erythritol, d-fucose, l-fucose, gluconate, 2-ketogluconate, 5-ketogluconate, glycerol, glycogen, inositol, inulin, d-lyxose, d-sorbitol, l-sorbose, d-tagatose, xylitol or l-xylose.
MK-7 is the major isoprenoid quinone.
The major cellular fatty acids are anteiso-C15 : 0 and iso-C16 : 0.
The diagnostic diamino acid in the cell-wall hydrolysates is meso-diaminopimelic acid.
The type strain, P2-1T (=KCTC 13135T=PCU 305T=TISTR 1888T), was isolated from a soil sample.
The DNA G+C content of the type strain is 52.7 mol%.
